stream_context.summary: Kaze focused almost the entire session on redesigning the mine section of Course 12.  He removed a whole sub-area, moved the train-station entrance, laid out a Goomba bandit hideout lit by new fireplaces, experimented with red-coin placement, and planned a momentum-based mine-cart sequence.  He also did light engine/tool work (compiler warnings, draw-distance flags) and talked about a new in-development Project64 ‘Legacy’ build he is using.

development_findings.summary: Course 12 was ‘not very good’, so Kaze deleted one area and relocated the train station to the main hub.
development_findings.quote: I thought about it and I realized the course is not very good. And I think now it is good.

development_findings.summary: A Boshi quick-draw cut-scene will replace the old Goombas-in-trenchcoat gag; the player must press B before Boshi shoots to earn a star.
development_findings.quote: We're gonna have a Boshi. There's gonna be a countdown and you have to press B before he does to kill him. Then he gives you a star.

development_findings.summary: New mine subsection: Goomba gang hideout with cork-gun enemies, wobbly platforms and drivable mine-carts whose inertia can launch Mario to higher ledges.
development_findings.quote: Our mission is to work on this area here in the mines… the rest is kind of like crazy mine cart stuff.

development_findings.summary: Red-coin logic: coins span multiple areas via B-parameters; red-coin star is bootless so Mario is not kicked out.
development_findings.quote: The red coin stars are bootless. I have to give them B-parameters so they can be across areas.

development_findings.summary: Added a 200-triangle fireplace model; experimented with particle colour, per-area draw-distance overrides, and custom UVs to keep N64 performance.
development_findings.quote: Oh my god, this looks so good… a thousand firefly triangles, right? This is just a little more than a vanilla Mario 64 level.

development_findings.summary: Talked through making collision data arrays at level-load time for faster look-ups— a possible future optimisation note.
development_findings.quote: Maybe there should just be arrays formed when the level boots… performance tweaks, make collision into arrays.

development_findings.summary: Still chasing one stubborn compiler warning (fp register bound to multiple values across threads); tried pragma system_header to silence.
development_findings.quote: That warning cannot be ignored… on every thread, this register has a different value.

development_findings.summary: Engine now tested on Project64 Legacy (1.6.2) — retains 1.6 UI but fixes audio crackle, crashes and instruction support.
development_findings.quote: Basically there is a project… using Project 64 1.6's UI but they're importing new emulation features.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is cutting weight aggressively (down 17 lbs, currently 210 lbs) and acknowledges injuring himself by rushing goals.
context_findings.quote: I set a goal and I want to reach all my goals immediately so I just work towards my goals with no exceptions.

context_findings.summary: Displays rising frustration at repeated emulator recommendations from chat; says it makes him ‘start to hate emulators’.
context_findings.quote: I am a little bit on edge about people recommending me emulators… it's getting so annoying.

context_findings.summary: Personal design philosophy: dislikes traditional boss fights that force waiting; prefers freeform bosses where you can always deal damage.
context_findings.quote: Most of the bosses are like freeform bosses… so you never have that situation where you just stand around awkwardly and wait.

biobak.summary: Biobak will later ‘rework’ Course 12 visuals; current placeholder assets may be replaced.
biobak.quote: During the reworking, Biobak is just gonna remove this and put his own thing.

zeina.summary: Only casual chat banter; no project work noted this session.

key_stories.title: Course 12 Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Kaze realised the western-themed course felt weak.  He deleted a whole sub-area, moved the train station to the hub and conceived a Boshi quick-draw encounter to inject character.
key_stories.challenge: Level layout ‘was not very good’ and felt empty.
key_stories.process: Removed one region, relocated entrances, mapped new mine area, scripted Boshi cut-scene concept.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze feels the course ‘is good’ now; mine area development continues.
key_stories.key_quote: We removed one area and instead the train station is right here now.

key_stories.title: Fireplace Asset Pipeline
key_stories.summary: Needed authentic lighting for Goomba camp.  Searched Model-Resource, imported an FBX, decimated to ~200 tris, rebuilt UVs and tested in-game, adjusting draw-distance and flame colour.
key_stories.challenge: Previous fireplace looked ugly and used wrong flame colour/draw distance.
key_stories.process: Imported, decimated, re-UV’d, created new material, extended draw distance flag.
key_stories.outcome: Visually satisfying campfires that also act as subtle navigation beacons.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh my god, this looks so good… that is the fire I was looking for.
